Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] (update) A quick FYI about compilation of the
 JSP pages
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=163406187
X-Yahoo-Profile: kristsi25

Update on this issue.

Recent change (post 0.6.0) includes a directive to Jetty to store the 
compiled JSP pages in a
fixed location. That means that the 'work' directory can be deleted.

This new change works equally well for dev. environment and our distros. 
Only remaining
issue is to include precompiled pages with the distros so that the 
'first time compile' will
be taken care of.

- Kris

Kristinn Sigur�sson wrote:

> Hi all,
>
> By default all JSP pages are recompiled each time you launch Heritrix.
> This is of course very annoying. But if you create a directory called
> 'work' in the ..../webapps/admin/WEB-INF/ directory then compiled
> pages will be stored there and reused between crawls.
>
> This works very well running from a dev. environment.
>
> Since our distributions pack the JSP files into a WAR file this does
> not apply to them.
>
> Hopefully though, our distributions will come with precompiled JSP
> pages in the very near future.
>
> Regards,
> Kristinn Sigurdsson
>
>
